No Poverty.reason: Course addresses economic diversification and social development in marginalized communities, aiming to improve local livelihoods.

Zero Hunger.reason: Includes agroecology and sustainable agriculture as part of local development strategies, supporting food security.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Indirect relevance through promoting sustainable, resilient communities and social equity, but health is not a primary focus.

Quality Education.reason: Course provides knowledge and practical skills in sustainable development and regional revitalization, enhancing student learning outcomes.

Gender Equality.reason: No explicit focus on gender issues is mentioned, although community development may indirectly support inclusion.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: Not explicitly addressed; may have minor indirect relevance through sustainable local development projects.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: Course mentions renewable energy and green technologies as part of building sustainable local economies.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: Strong focus on developing sustainable local economies, social enterprises, and entrepreneurial skills for community revitalization.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: Moderate relevance through promoting social enterprises, local economic innovation, and infrastructure for sustainable development.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Course addresses social equity and inclusion in marginalized and rural communities as a core theme.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: Direct focus on regional revitalization and community-based sustainable development projects.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: Indirectly addressed through sustainable agriculture, local economic strategies, and eco-friendly tourism practices.

Climate Action.reason: Course includes renewable energy and green technologies, contributing to mitigation of environmental impacts and climate change adaptation locally.

Life Below Water.reason: No direct focus on marine ecosystems; relevance is minimal.

Life on Land.reason: Sustainable agriculture and local environmental protection touch on terrestrial ecosystem management.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: Indirect relevance through fostering governance, community engagement, and stakeholder participation in local revitalization.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: Course emphasizes collaboration between local communities, NGOs, and government agencies, fostering partnerships in sustainable development initiatives.
